definitions.definition: In, on, or at this place (a place perceived to be close to the speaker); compare there .
examples: You wait here while I fetch my coat.
Ms. Doe is not here at the moment.
It says here that he died in 1970.
The view up here is better than the view down there!
Here is the report that you asked for.

subdefinitions.definition: At this point or stage (in a process, argument , narration , etc.)
examples: I've had enough of peeling potatoes. I'm stopping here .
You say that all men are born equal, but here I must disagree with you.

subdefinitions.definition: Notionally at the speaker's location by virtue of happening now.

examples: Derivatives can refer to anything that is derived from something else, but here they refer specifically to functions that give the slope of the tangent line to a curve.

subdefinitions.definition: After the name of a person perceived as located close to the speaker, used familiarly to indicate that person.
examples: Jim here has been with the company for twenty years.

subdefinitions.definition: After certain determiners, especially 'this' and 'these', used to emphasise demonstrative sense; see also this here .
examples: This here orange is too sour.

definitions.definition: To this place ; used in place of the literary or archaic hither .

main_definition: ( location ) In, on, or at this place (a place perceived to be close to the speaker); compare there .
secondary_definitions: ( location ) To this place ; used in place of the literary or archaic hither .
